column1: how 'bout a 139 kph yorker on middle stump to kick things off. It's not as if we've not had a wild old start already. Guptill makes sure to bring down a straight bat
firm push to mid-on as he lines up another full delivery on middle and leg stump. Those big pads on Guptill's front foot are definitely on the firing line

top save from the fielder, Cummins, diving headlong after the ball on the edge of the boundary and finishing up with a lovely back flick. Guptill had timed the flick through midwicket superbly. Just a little shuffle to off, concentrated on keeping his shape
good length, just outside off, Latham turns it to mid-on
presents the full face to a fuller delivery at 141 kph and picks the gap between mid-off and cover
some late swing there, into the pads at 142 kph, but Guptill handles it well, or well enough, keeping his front toe out of the way and clipping it to midwicket
covers the line of a fuller delivery on off stump and picks it away through midwicket
good single. Latham allows the back of a length ball to come to him on off stump and then just gently taps it to the left of second slip
full on off stump, Guptill steps forward to defend

fishes outside off, despite the two slips in place, and a thick outside edge flies away in the region of gully. No one there, though. Pin-point length from Hazlewood, inviting the drive, but not quite there for one

nicked past second slip! Shaun Marsh was the man diving to his left, but it would be rather cruel to call that a drop. Full blooded drive from Latham, having seen a full delivery angle across him, and a very thick edge just flies away
back of a length on off stump, Guptill covers it well

creams it through extra cover. Cummins pulled off a fine stop earlier, and though he does again fling himself face-first at the ball, it trickles across to the boundary. Half-volley, a wide one too, efficiently dealt with. Funny way to wish a mate a Happy Birthday, Latham. Starc's going to remember that
good length ball outside off, blocks it
back of a length and outside off, avoids it
good length on middle, Latham presses forward and defends around his front pad a touch

early birthday present for the big left-arm quick! This is a shortish delivery, heading down leg. Latham felt he could just ride it, nudge it to fine leg and get off strike, but he may have been undone by a little extra bounce. Cramped for room, with the ball suddenly big on him, he looks all kinds of awkward, gloving through to Handscomb, the stand-in wicketkeeper. Happy 27th, fella
and the cost of those men in the cordon is a gap at midwicket, which Williamson exploits with a deft little flick. Starc goes a touch too straight

plan A definitely seems to be get him lbw. Full, with just enough inswing to have Guptill falling over in front of middle stump while he is flicking. Gets enough wood on it for a single through midwicket though
nimbly deflects the fuller ball to long leg as Hazlewood fires it full and on middle and leg
firm push to mid-off as Hazlewood corrects his line to outside off. Still a delightfully full length
gets up on his toes to blunt a shortish delivery on middle and leg and pick up a single to the right of midwicket

has the room to free the arms - and the tiny boundaries to tempt him - and bang goes Guptill. Shimmies down to get the ball on the half-volley and pastes it over extra cover. No intention to keep it down

huge appeal for an lbw, meanwhile, Guptill has been dragged by his captain to the other end. So, how close is this? I thought leg stump was in play. The batsman shuffles across and seems to be in front, but perhaps the bounce might have saved him? He's hit above the flap of the pad
fuller delivery on middle and off, defends

gets it past mid-off. Not the best of efforts. He has a little distance to move to his left, Cummins is the man, who might well have got to the ball a bit quicker than he needed to. Slides past it as a mistimed drive gets Guptill a second boundary
shortish on middle and leg, Guptill nudges it into the leg side
ripper, and at 143 kph too. This is a good length ball, skirting across the right-hander, drawing him into an on-the-up drive and laughing maniacally past the edge

edged, through the wicketkeeper! So a drop then. Tough to call again for this was a solid top edge off a full blooded cut. Handscomb has to jump up, push his hands high over his head, but just wasn't quick enough
goes full and wide and Guptill throws his hands at the ball, lashing it through extra cover
back of a length on off stump, gets up on top of it and blocks
presses forward to a full delivery outside off and keeps it out
works it into the leg side, where Stoinis keeps it to a single
good length ball on off stump, met with the straight face of the bat
with fine leg up, at the ball slanted into the pads at 147 kph, it's not rocket science for the batsman to use that pace and flick it to the boundary behind them
keeps him in the crease with a good length ball on middle. Guptill defends
good length ball outside off, seen through to the wicketkeeper's care

tries to work a shortish delivery from off stump through midwicket, but it kicks up off the surface a touch more than Williamson expects, and having made contact off the high part of the bat, he can't manoeuvre the ball
half an appeal for lbw as Williamson tries to flick a good length ball off leg stump. Would have slid down
a little seam away from the bat, but considering it was rather a bit too wide of off stump, Williamson ignores it
presses forward to a good length ball outside off and keeps it out
on the pads and Williamson directs it to long leg with a roll of his wrists
on the pads again at 142 kph, Williamson is not quite quick enough on the draw with his flick and has to settle for a leg bye towards square leg
works a full delivery from outside off through to deep midwicket
digs it in, and the bouncer at 145 kph, soars over a ducking Williamson and forces Handscomb into a big stretch to his left. Doesn't quite collect it cleanly
good length ball, aiming at the top of off stump, Williamson defends it properly
picks the gap to the right of mid-on. Seems to be a stroke he's been working on, getting back of a length deliveries on off stump and flicking them into the leg side
oooh, almost plays on. Williamson is surprised by a good length ball, which keeps a touch lower than he expects. Hits the bottom edge and wanders past the off stump
on middle and leg and Guptill works it in front and to the right of mid-on. Soft hands
fuller delivery on off stump, met by the Williamson defence.
goes for the push down the ground, but he checks his shot, which is probably why mid-on is able to move to his left and stop it
heaves it to the (short) long leg boundary. Punishes the bowler for an error in line, and the short ball slipping down leg is pulled to the left of the fielder there.
opens the face as he stays beside the back of a length ball on middle and off. Yells 'no,' as he realises he didn't place it well
fullish on off stump, blocks it
shortish on off stump, Guptill gets up on his toes to beat it down by his feet
good bouncer again, right over middle and off, and at 145 kph too. Guptill does excellently, bending his knees and swaying out of the way. That means he can watch the ball all through
full on middle, Guptill works it through square leg, letting the ball come onto him
there for the drive, this 146 kph delivery, but Guptill doesn't time it properly. Full and wide delivery not made the best use of

oooh, this 144 kph delivery beats everyone. It was the bounce and pace that does Guptill, who was swaying his torso back to try and upper cut the ball. No dice. Then it decides to move in the air much to the wicketkeeper's chagrin, making his stretch to his left. Doesn't reach it in time
through midwicket and away it goes. Good way for New Zealand to wrap up the first 10 overs.
shortish and outside off, Williamson drags it across to the man at deep square leg with a pull. That single also brings up the fifty partnership
off-pace delivery again and Guptill doesn't read it. Lovely deception. Pitches it on a good length and manages to get a little more bounce than the batsman expects, to hit him on the thigh
fuller delivery outside off, drives it past mid-on's left
'catch,' is the cry as Williamson goes for an uppish lash over point. Beats third man on the boundary, who was fine
moves across onto off stump to glance a shortish delivery on middle to long leg
good length ball on off stump, defends to mdiwicket
glides a back of a length delivery to deep third man. Uses all the 142 kph pace to his own benefit
opens the face at the last second to try and beat the man at point, but this 146 kph delivery doesn't let him do so

lifts it over the wicketkeeper! This is purely intentional. This is absolutely brilliant. In the idea at least, if not the execution. Guptill knows Cummins is giving him so much pace than he knows what to do with, and so the moment it is pitched short, even if it is on middle, he swerves his torso back and ramps it
bangs it into middle of the deck and gives the batsman an easy sighter. Bouncer avoided
121 kph, that's the slower ball, full on off stump, Guptill picks it, blocks it into the cover point region for a single
back of a length and just outside off, defends
angles it into the pads and Guptill is unable to do what he wants to, tickle it past the left of short fine leg, which would have been a boundary
good length ball outside off, Williamson directs it off the open face to deep third man
oh, misses out again. And this is a poorer ball than earlier in the over because the line is way down leg. Guptill manages to get bat, but the flick shot picks out short fine leg - the only man there

full and wide outside off, and Guptill is able to pick the gap between point and short third man. He was originally intending to glide it, but seeing as the delivery didn't have much pace but gave him all the room he needed to free his arms, he hit it a lot harder
defends towards point, with soft hands, and sneaks a single
gets on top of the bounce of this shortish delivery on off stump and whips it through midwicket
pretty full and outside off, Williamson leans back, plays very, very late and ends up chopping the ball behind to the keeper
good length and angled in at off stump, uses his wrists and manoeuvres the ball to square leg
back of a length and on off stump, Guptill hangs back and chops a cheeky single to the right of Handscomb behind the stumps
just short of a good length and outside off, leans back, gently punches in front of point and sets off to the other end
rising short ball outside off, Guptill rises with it and blunts the ball to cover

bat-pad catch to backward point running to his left. Big appeal from Stoinis and the keeper. Umpire Knights' finger goes up. Stoinis snaffles Williamson in his first over. Back of a length and angled in at off stump, kicks up, Williamson jumps off the ground and seeks to work the ball to the leg side. The ball grazes the inside edge, then the thigh pad, and pops up to Maxwell. Williamson is Stonis' maiden one-day international victim. How about that for a start? Not sure if that was the cutter from Stoinis - he can bowl a cunning offcutter which bounces at the batsman
full and outside off, pushed down to mid-off
wide yorker, squeezed out
full and angling away outside off, presses forward and drives back to Starc
length ball, shaped to come in, then seams away past the skittish waft
back of a length and slanting away outside off, Guptill helps it down to third man for one
pitched up and slanting away outside off, left alone
back of a length and outside off, Guptill runs it down to third man. He raises his bat and acknowledges his half-century, taking in the applause from the home crowd.
Stoinis runs in hard, hits the deck hard, this one absolutely flies off the surface, and beats a leaping Handscomb. Tough day behind the stumps. Taylor avoided it. Five wides it is
length and outside off, Taylor simply taps it down to third man
tip-and-run single to the left of the keeper
excellent placement and running to boot from Taylor. Fullish and on off, Taylor, with a more pronounced side-on stance, simply dabs it in the gap at square leg
nice and full outside off, Taylor flows forward and drives through the line. Hits crisply but can't beat mid-off now
back of a length and outside off, jabbed to point and that's drinks
back of a length, bounces at Guptill, 140ks, catches him in an awkward tangle
short on leg stump, 139.6ks, tucks 'em up for room. Guptill fends it back to Starc
just short of a good length and speared wide outside off, Guptill flat-bats a cut to sweeper
very full and wide outside off, Taylor watches it through to the keeper
very full and on a set of stumps outside off, Taylor does not bother going after it
Taylor brings up New Zealand's hundred with a sliced drive. Full and much closer to off, opens the face and carves it away between the covers and point
just short of a good length and angled in on off, the batsman hangs back and plays it back to the bowler
length and outside off, tip-and-run single to point
full and outside off, presses forward, meets the pitch and drives the ball to short cover
short and outside off, Taylor does not need any second invitations for the cut. Chopped down to third man
short of a length and outside off, Guptill gets up on his tippy toes and plays a jabbing punch square through the off side
back of a length and sort of skids through outside off, Guptill is stapled to the crease as he swishes and only connects with thin air
full and slow on off stump, Taylor shuffles across off, goes low, and paddles to long leg
quick fizzer down leg, left alone
straight ball on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket

Handscomb's day gets tougher. He is nutmegged. Guptill pre-meditates shuffling outside leg stump for a scoop to the left of the keeper. Guptill is beaten, as is the keeper, as the ball goes through his legs
pretty full and slid across off stump, Guptill edges it, the ball grazes the pad of Handscomb and streaks away down towards third man
veering into the pads, tucked around the corner
leg-side wide
paddled down towards long leg
short and wide outside off, thumps a cut to the left of Maxwell. He spins around, aims at the striker's end, and misses. Taylor was off for a single, a direct hit could have dismissed Taylor
back of a length and outside off, Taylor rides it down to third man for one
just short of a good length on middle, fended back to the bowler

'wait, wait' is the call from Guptill. But Taylor is too eager for the single. Back of a length and outside off, sticks in the surface. Guptill attempts a punch and ends up squirting the ball to Maxwell at point. A direct hit could have been tight there too
short and skidding into the hips, fended square on the leg side
Taylor takes Maxwell's arm on for the third time in six balls. Tips it to point and scampers across. Maxwell still can't connect with a direct hit. This time he misses at the striker's end
flatter on the pads, knocked to short fine leg
skidding into the pads, pitched outside leg, Taylor does not make contact with a paddle sweep and weathers the leg-before appeal
this time Taylor succeeds in paddling a single down to long leg
Guptill skips out, Head drags his length back, this one angles across the batsman, takes the edge and rolls down fine of short third man
full on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
pitched up on off, driven to mid-off, who is inside the circle
chest-high short ball outside off, Taylor is ready for it on the back foot, rolling his wrists and pulling to deep square leg
length ball, wicket-to-wicket stuff, played back to Stoinis
length ball on off, drives on the up, hits through the line to mid-off
high short ball outside off, boings off the surface, Taylor can't hook it away
full and outside off, whipped away on the front foot to straight midwicket
pitched up and outside off, driven to the right of mid-off for one now. Taylor chances another single. Finch can't throw the stumps down
back of a length and outside off, firmly struck more or less straight to mid-off
fired on leg or just outside leg, swept to long leg
full on middle, not much turn, push-driven to long-on

too full for the sweep and Taylor drags it back onto the stumps. Tossed up and angling across off, wide outside off, Taylor goes low and makes a mess of the sweep. Head reaps reward for some tight bowling
looped up on middle and leg, Broom - returning from a finger injury, works through midwicket
flatter and quicker, swept away to square leg
pushed through quicker, Guptill defends
waddles across off and deflects a ball ball square on the leg side
ull and angled in on off, spooned in front of midwicket
full and angled in on off, punched to cover on the front foot

bowled'em. Stoinis has nabbed both Williamson and Guptill. Sneaks through the gate. Half-volley length, bowled from wide of the crease, right up there to be laced through the covers. Guptill attempts a drive, but the ball cuts back in slightly and goes through the defences. Hits middle and leg stumps with the offcutter
full on the pads, whipped away through deep square leg
glanced off the hips to square leg
wicket-to-wicket line, bunted to straight midwicket
flighted and angled across off, gets forward, meets the pitch, and eases it through cover
fired outside off, driven to the straighter of the two catching covers
full and on off, dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch. Pushed to mid-on off the inside half
Handscomb drops another catch. Shorter offbreak from Head, spins away from the left-hander. He goes back for a cut, outside-edges it behind, the ball clangs off the gloves
tossed on middle, driven on the front foot to long-on

length and outside off, Munro shovels it in the air off the inside half and hands a loopy catch to Finch. Not a full-blooded hit from the left-hander. He aimed to clear mid-on, instead chipped it to Australia's captain. So Handscomb's drop costs Australia just one run
left alone outside off
leg-side delivery, glided down to long leg
offcutter, comes in, beats the inside edge and clatters into the back thigh
full and angled in on off, tucked around the corner through square leg
full on middle and leg, worked through backward square leg for a double
wicket-to-wicket line from around the stumps, flipped through square leg
looped up outside off, Neesham presses forward and hoists it over the short straight boundary. First boundary after 10 overs
picked off the pads to the leg side for one
sliding into the leg stump, directed to long leg for one
short and skids on, defended on the back foot
shorter and outside off, skips back and cuts through cover-point for one
full and skidding across off, Neesham has a loose waft and watches the ball whistle past the outside edge
short and outside off, hangs back and chops down to third man
worked off the pads to square leg
overpitched and outside off, front-foot drive. Placed to the left of extra cover and to the right of mid-off. The latter makes a tumbling save
tucked off the hips to long leg
short of a length and outside off, dabbed down to wide slip
back of a length on off, hops and nurdles a single in front of midwicket
142.5ks short ball outside off, Neesham is beaten for pace. He is rushed into a hook and ends up top-edging the ball over the keeper's head. Evades long leg sliding to his right. One-bounce four
bouncer, ducks under it
short of a length and slanting away outside off, Neesham has a waft away from the body. The ball grazes the inside edge and rolls away past the stumps fine on the leg side. French-cut away
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket on the front foot
full offcutter, opens the face and runs the ball to point
short of a length and outside off, arches his back and upper-cuts to third man
biffed down the ground to the right of mid-on. Back of a length and outside off, stood up tall and punched away past the bowler's left
short of a length and outside off, chopped away to the right of Maxwell at backward point
leg-stump delivery, which is easily glanced to long leg

Marsh drops it at wide slip diving across to his right. Went with one hand, the ball popped out of it. Full and angling across off, Neesham wafts with his feet stapled to the crease and gets away. Marsh was late onto it
full and outside off, steered into the covers for one
pretty full on the pads, glanced to long leg
short of a length and outside off, jumps back and secures a single to deep third man with a late cut
half-volley outside off, drilled on the front foot straight to mid-off
back of a length on off, hangs back and works it past midwicket's right for one
short of a length on the hips, tucked around the corner, through square leg
full on off, clipped to the right of square leg for a couple
short of a length on off, chopped behind square on the off side for one. To the left of Maxwell at backward point
full and sliding into the pads, Neesham misses out on a scoring opportunity. That should have been put away through midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, hangs back and whips through midwicket for two. Excellent running. End of an uninterrupted spell from Stoinis: 10-0-49-3. And that's drinks at Eden Park

well, that bodes well for New Zealand, moving into the final stage of the innings. Broom waits on a shortish delivery outside off, letting it come on and then chops down on it. Late cut past deep third man's right

squares him up with the angle from over the wicket as a back of a length ball pitches on leg stump and decks away off the seam. Broom, intending to work the ball to midwicket, gets a leading edge past point
into the pads and Neesham, trying to glance it fine, doesn't get any bat on it. Could have easily been a boundary with fine leg up
strikes him in the box, or close to, I think. A little bit of seam movement into the left-hander, who is surprised by the movement, the ball beating his inside edge and pinning him
shortish and outside off, Neesham looks for a cut, but plays the shot under the ball. No footwork
length ball outside off, flat-batted through the covers. That's the back of the hand slower ball, bringing up the fifty-partnership. And they've got there in 49 balls
cramps him up with a 132 kph delivery on off stump, Neesham goes for the pull, but is perhaps into the shot just a touch late. Inside edge onto his thigh
nudges the back of a length ball to the left of midwicket
tries to work a good length ball on off stump through the leg side, but finds midwicket
shortish and outside off, chops it down by his feet. The late cut goes awry there
covers the line of a shortish delivery on middle and off and clips it to midwicket
full on off stump, pushes it to mid-on
gets under a short delivery outside off and heaves it to deep midwicket
back of the hand slower ball, just outside off, Broom attempts to glide it to third man again, but is surprised by the kick off the pitch. Nearly gloves it to the keeper
extra bounce as Faulkner comes around the wicket, the slower ball biting into the pitch and leaping up towards the splice of the bat
fuller ball outside off, drives through to the man sweeping on the off side boundary
flashes outside off, but without proper footwork he has no hope of making connection. Good slower ball from Faulkner again

digs it in short, Broom goes for a pull and Hazlewood barely even asks for a caught behind appeal, but the umpire Palliyaguruge says sure, why not? The batsman goes for a review straight away though and with nothing on both HotSpot and Snicko, the on-field decision is overruled. Take nothing away from the ball though, climbed up towards Broom's left shoulder, cramping him up and preventing him from making good, or any, connection
shortish and outside off, dabs it to deep third man
shortish and outside off, cuts to point

nails the pull, hit so far in front of square that it should deflate a fast bowler. Hazlewood tries to go short again, but this time it didn't quite rise up high enough. Neesham takes it from outside off and swings it past midwicket
flat-batted over mid-on! Gets the length to go up and over with a straight bat and he doesn't waste it
works it into the leg side, behind square
full and down leg - it's the off-pace delivery again - Neesham rolls his wrists and sends it to deep square leg
pats a back of a length delivery outside off to cover
invites the drive and gets it as Neesham finds cover again
carves it between point and cover, standing up tall against a short and wide delivery. Brings up New Zealand's 200
gets up on his toes and flicks a short delivery off his hip towards short fine leg

rather a bit full to be attempting a cut shot, and again Neesham is beaten. Faulkner's seen this almost every over since coming back to bowl in his second spell and he has his hands on his hips, not amused at his luck
attempts to clip a shortish delivery into the leg side, but takes it high on the pad instead

rushes down the track and hammers it onto the sightscreen. Takes till the 38th over for the first six on a ground where the straight boundary is about 60 m. Top shot from Broom though, changing a length ball into an overpitched one with his footwork. Actually damages the sightscreen electronics
opens the face and runs a short of a length delivery past backward point
stays deep in his crease to hatchet a short delivery on middle and up and over the leg side infield to long-on
length ball outside off, defends to point

top edge as he pulls and deep midwicket takes a simple catch. Excellent time for a wicket and it comes from their Mr Dependable. Simple, back of a length, not much room to free the arms. Neesham tries to make a bit too much of it and mistimes his shot. Head steadies himself a few yards inside the fence and takes it well
full on middle and leg, turns it to midwicket
guides it to sweeper cover
steps forward to a fuller delivery outside off and the bat face turns in his hands as the ball thuds into it. Mid-on mops up
tucks a full delivery on leg stump to midwicket
comes forward and defends a fuller ball outside off with the inside edge
changes the pace, and this 124 kph delivery, is aimed at the base of off stump. Santner keeps it out
digs it in, but lines it down the leg side. Broom goes for a pull but he fails to make any connection
on the pads and Broom, trying to deflect it off his hip, gets an inside edge and finds a single at square leg
fuller delivery on off stump, defends off the open face
good length ball on middle, Santner covers it
a little room to work with and Santner punches the length ball through the covers
swivels on his back foot as he takes a bouncer on and pulls it to long leg
back of a length on middle and leg, keeps it out
starts around the wicket and beats Broom, who is trying to late cut a back of a length slower ball which cramps him for room
guides it behind point for a couple of runs
looks for the yorker, but ends up with a low full toss. Broom lets it run off to deep midwicket
full on off stump, Santner blocks the 143 kph delivery to midwicket
length ball, on the pads, and Santner, who is pushing deep in his crease, finds midwicket again
gets an inside edge as he tries to push a fuller delivery to mid-off and instead steals a single to long leg
fuller delivery outside off, pushes it to mid-off and pinches a single
pulls, but can only get a single for it because Hazlewood hasn't given any room for Broom to work with
swats a bouncer, coming up past his chest, to short midwicket
belts a full delivery just outside off to a deepish mid-off
lets the short ball come onto him and deflects it behind square leg

pushes him back with one coming up to his chest, on leg stump, so the only option for Santner is to bunt it down the pitch. Intelligent cricket from Hazlewood, forcing the batsman into awkward positions when all he is thinking about is hitting the ball hard
carves a full and wide delivery to deep point
good length on off stump, Santner taps and runs to cover. Excellent single, and Broom showing the requisite desperation with a big dive to beat a direct hit from jersey number 9. Possibly Heazlett?
spins on his back foot to pull a short ball from outside off to deep midwicket
backs away from a full delivery on leg stump and drills it to long-on
that's well played. He picks the slower ball, at 124 kph, and gives it a good thrashing. Strong hands, which slice the ball over backward point
full and just outside off, as Starc moves around the wicket to cut the angle, Broom steers it to point
moves leg side, he is preempting the short-ball tactic from Hazlewood, and punches the ball through cover
that's a ripper. At 136 kph, it hits the deck just outside off and surprises a set batsman with extra bounce. Broom is thinking about a glide to third man, but the ball soars over his gloves
another shortish delivery outside off and Broom, while trying to tap it to third man, refuses to go through with the shot. Worried about losing his wicket here
covers the line of a back of a length delivery on off stump and blocks. Cross-seamer that
that's another cross-seamer, pitched up, asking the drive. Broom goes for it, walking into the shot, aiming at the covers. He is beaten
gets down low with a full delivery outside off and runs it to third man. That's the end of Hazlewood, with six overs to go.
gets his fifty with a phenomenal extra cover drive. It's length. He sees he can get under it. And he pummels it over the top. Eden Park roars
slings down a yorker at 146 kph, from wide of the crease, and Broom digs it out to point

another yorker, angled sharply into the leg stump. Broom falls over as he tries to flick and is hit on the pads. Shouldn't be out lbw, the umpire doesn't give it, but Australia review. There's no bat, and on impact, middle and off stump are visible, an indication that it would miss the leg. HawkEye confirms

has he taken it? Hazlewood leaps in the air, right on the edge of the boundary at third man, and comes up with a one-hander. So cool. So calm. Tracking it all the way. Such a super effort. But is his foot on the line? He isn't entirely happy with the effort, so that's an indicator that he felt the advertising skirting on his boot. The short boundaries at Eden Park comes to Broom's rescue and his upper cut to a short ball wide outside off comes off.
spears a 145 kph delivery down the leg side, Broom tries to get his bat on it with a flick but he has no chance
full on off stump, defends
full and outside off, drives through point
shortish and just outside off, Broom guides it past the wicketkeeper's right

what a shot, but oh, there's a fielder there, it's Maxwell, and its a stunning catch! Flashes a little grin after running several yards to his right, eyes always on the ball, taking it cleanly as he bends low and then gets into a military-style roll with the momentum he had going. Top effort. And one of the few times Santner times the ball, and he did so well to back away to make his own room against a good short ball
guides a shortish delivery to deep third man

oopsy, the stand-in keeper mucks up. It's the slower ball outside off, Broom tries the dab to third man, but comes up with nothing. The ball bounces before it reaches Handscomb and spins away to his left
backs away and goes for the upper cut and he hasn't got enough on it. Third man comes up off the boundary, steadies himself and takes a good catch. Faulkner the man there
and he does so, dabbing a back of a length delivery to deep third man
full and quite a distance outside off, Broom can collect the extra
lashes it over extra cover. He's playing a gem of an innings, but at this point it is unsure whether it will be enough. Gets length, thrashes length
digs out a yorker to point
beaten for pace as a 145 kph delivery, a wide yorker, skips past the flashing blade

slings a full delivery into the pads and Broom is struck on the toe at full pace, he's floored too, but has enough of his faculties to take a leg bye. Outstanding yorker bowler, this fellow, and this angle from around the wicket, wide of the crease, with that slingy arm action makes it all the more difficult
145 kph, full and straight at the stumps, Ferguson manages to keep it out
low full toss, pushes it to deep point. Broom says no on the single to keep the strike

good bowling. that's the slower ball, dug into the middle of the deck, biting into it and cutting into the right-hander. Broom goes for a cut, lets out a loud grunt too by evidence of the stump mics, and is beaten
too straight, too easy to be picked up. Broom clears his front leg and heaves it over the long leg boundary, well to the left of the man in the deep
reaches out in front of him, over his shoulder, to drag a short ball from outside off to deep midwicket

bouncer, aims it at Ferguson's left ear, avoids it. The square leg umpire Wayne Knights originally intended to signal wide, but then changed his mind. Good bowling, although Eden Park boos at the lack of a wide
shortish and outside off, slashed behind point
backs away and cuts a short delivery on off stump to deep point. Keep the strike with two overs to go
that's the back of the hand slower ball, from over the wicket, Broom wanders outside off to try and scoop it to the long leg boundary but misses it completely
another slower ball, this one full and outside off, drills it to cover
106kph, change of pace, at a full length and outside off, Ferguson skews it to short third man

comes down the track and hoists a back of the hand slower ball on leg stump to long-on. End of a fine innings from Broom, who has basically had to fight all on his lonesome all through the middle overs
pokes at a slower ball but fails to make contact
full toss outside off, slaps it to long-on
these two were there two years ago, but it was Williamson who hit Cummins for six to win the game. Here Boult gets his piece, backing away and carving the bouncer over the third man boundary
off the splice to mid-off, as the short ball angled into the body is met with a full-on swipe. Looking to square leg, but beaten soundly for pace
dabs a shortish delivery into the covers
hammers it over straight midwicket. Right off the middle, and his tactic to run away to the leg side and make his own room while Cummins is trying to cramp him works superbly
lands a yorker, which meanders down the leg side. The umpire gives the bowler a little bit of leeway with Boult having made a move back and well outside off

finishes the innings in style, the back foot is camped deep in the crease, the front foot is nowhere to be found as Boult belts a length delivery outside off to the long-off boundary. Timely cameo from the No. 11
short of a length and angled in, jumps off the ground and plays back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, punched to cover
good length and swings away outside off, patted to backward point
full inswinger, which is worked away to midwicket. Australia and Finch are off the mark
short of a length and skids on outside off, jabbed out to point
good length on middle, Head gets behind the line and defends to the off side
back of a length, angling away wide outside off, Finch has to reach out for the ball. Slashed over cover-point. Finch clutches his left hamstring right after making contact with the ball
leg-stump ball, deflected to long leg
very full and angled in on middle and leg, squeezed out to midwicket
full, around off, hint of outswing, pushed to point
just short of a good length and outside off, throws his bat at ball and chops behind to the keeper
full outswinger outside off, reaches out for the ball with his hands, slicing a drive to Broom at backward point
back of a length and slanting away outside off, Head reaches out for another ambitious cut. Under-edges it behind to the keeper
fractionally short and outside off, Head skips back, picks it up and pulls emphatically over midwicket
not as short as the previous ball, chopped from outside off to backward point
pitched up and outside off, Head responds with a front-foot drive straight of mid-off
good length and angling away outside off, Head drops it to the off side, adjacent to his feet
Head, who is standing on leg stump, shuffles across and crunches a drive, but can't beat the well-populated off-side field

Neesham dives to his right from square leg, reaches for the ball with both hands, and plucks it out. Boult and Neesham combine to send back Australia's stand-in captain. Not a happy comeback for Finch. Hip-high short ball outside off, Finch simply flaps a pull to square leg
nudged to the left of Santner at short midwicket. Marsh sets off for a single. A direct hit from Santner could have had Head
very full and slanted in on off, played back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, forced to cover
holes out to deep third man running in. Eden Park raises itself to a roar. Back of a length and very wide outside off, Head flails at it. The ball swirls into the hands of Munro off a top edge
the length is short for the cut but this is too close to the body. Chopped behind past the off stump
very full on middle and leg, hangs back and clips to midwicket
very full, hint of inswing, flicked to mid-on
good length and slanting away outside off, dabbed to cover
full and angling away outside off, opens the face and dinks the ball wide enough of wide slip. Played down to third man
full and straight on middle, blocked with a straight bat to mid-off
short of a length and outside off, Handscomb is happy to camp back and run it down to third man
back of a length and width outside off, Handscomb jumps onto the width and punches it in the gap at cover
full and angled into a defence to the off side
short of a length and angled outside off, Handscomb plays at the last possible moment and glides it down to third man
full and holds its line outside off, Marsh watches it through to the keeper
full and floated on middle, Marsh ventures forward and across to negotiate it
back of a length and kicks away outside off, beats the attempted cut

there's a clicking sound as the stand-in keeper Latham gloves the ball. Umpire Knight shakes his head. NZ challenge the on-field not-out decision. Cross-seamer from Southee. Handsomb simply prods at it away from the body, and nicks it behind. Hotspot detects a white blotch and nicko detects a spike as the ball passes the bat. Handscomb has to go. Umpire Knight reverses his call, raises his finger, and sends back Handscomb
Maxwell is greeted by a short ball, angled in on off, pulls and gets enough bat on it to send the ball away fine on the leg side past the diving keeper
full and outside off, guided through backward point
nice and full outside off - not a half-volley, Marsh flows forward and drives it smoothly straight of mid-off
Southee drags his length back outside off, Marsh punches into the covers
back of a length and slanting away outside off, opens the face and dabs to backward point
back of a length on leg stump, whipped to midwicket on the back foot
tight line and length, no room at all, defended back to the bowler
picked away off the hips to long leg
short on middle and leg, and with fine leg up, Marsh gets inside the line and helps it away fine of short fine leg
short and skids off the deck outside off, Marsh is opened up as he sends an outside edge flying in the air... Taylor leaps but can only tip it over
short and wide outside off, flayed away to backward point, sprawling save from Munro
good length, Southee brings out the offbreak variation, Marsh waits on the ball and defends to the off side
full on off, pushed back on the front foot
short of a length and outside off, leans back and cuts to point
full and sliding into the leg stump, clipped away square through the leg side to the right of long leg
De Grandhomme, subbing for Broom, throws himself to his right from backward point and stops this full-blooded cut
back of a length on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
shot. Full on off, Maxwell punches on the front foot, through the legs of the non-striker, and skips away straight of mid-on
back of a length and angled in on off, defended
full on the pads from over the wicket, knocked in the direction of midwicket
short and wide outside off, thrashes a cut to the right of extra cover, tumbling save
short and hurries on outside off, fended to leg
short and wide outside off, forced to deep point on the back foot
very full and slanted in, chipped to mid-on
short of a length and angling away outside off, punched past backward point, but deep third man hunts it down
ripping bouncer outside off, throat-high delivery, 149ks - pace like fire - Maxwell drops his wrists and rocks out of the way
short and sliding across off, pushed back, Santner dives to his left and stops it

Santner beats Marsh in the air. Marsh uses his feet, Santner drags his length back, the ball dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch. The batsman misses a straight ball - okay spins in slightly - and Latham the stand-in keeper does the rest. Poor shot from Marsh. Looked very ungainly
flat and angled across off from around the wicket, punched back to Santner
drifting into the leg stump, tucked to deep midwicket
more round-arm than usual, clatters into the front pad of Maxwell, heading down
tossed outside off, pushed to cover on the front foot
bouncer outside off, upper-cuts and misses
dragged short and outside off, shovelled to deep midwicket
short and angled in on the hips, helped away fine on the leg side. Sensible stuff
short of a length on middle, 150ks, punched to mid-on
nasty short ball, hits the deck, rears up and Maxwell somehow fends on the pitch

Nicked off. Australia are five down and sinking at Eden Park. 142.3ks, back of a length and outside off, Maxwell was aiming to run it down to third man. He only feathers it behind to Latham. He's having a good day behind the stumps, unlike Handscomb
flatter on middle and leg, glanced to long leg
looped up outside off, pushed to the left of the bowler
round-armed into the pads, nudged to the leg side
fast slider, defended with a straight bat
drifts in on off, drops at the batsman, chipped to the left of the bowler
tossed up on leg stump, knocked down to long-on
short and angled on leg or just outside leg, hunkers down
back of a length and angled in on off, played back to the bowler
back of a length, kicks and screams at Stoinis. He fends it down
full and slung into the pads, diverted square on the leg side
short and wide outside off, slashes a cut down to third man
short and outside off, Ferguson is too quick for the debutant. Attempts a pull and watches the ball dribble back to the bowler
nudged off the pads to short fine leg
shortish and angled in on off, back-foot punch back to Santner
sliding into the hips, directed to short fine leg
flighted nicely on middle, this full ball is driven back to the bowler
short and just outside off, short-armed away to midwicket
short and angled in, raps the glove as the ball lobs to the off side
short and just below the chest, hops and fends to midwicket
back of a length on off, punched back to the bowler
short and slung into the pads, tucked around the corner
good length and angled in on off, Stoinis does well to come forward, meet the pitch, and defend it back to the bowler
short and fizzes on outside off, Stoinis is beaten for pace. The ball grazes the inside edge and streaks away to leg-gully
pushes it through from over the wicket into the pads, Heazlett picks it away to long leg
goes back to a flatter delivery on off stump and keeps it out
spots the short ball so early and then powers it away over straight midwicket. Solid base on the back foot, reads the lack of turn, knows he can hit into the leg side as he pleases
good length ball on off stump - much better line for the rapid pace he's bowling - defends
that's a lot slower, brings Stoinis forward with a block in front of off stump
drives fluently through to long-off to retain strike
back of a length and just outside off, Stoinis stands tall and punches into the covers

all pace. Or rather the perception of it for Ferguson's throttled down has paralysed Heazlett's feet. In an effort to compensate, he throws his hands at a back of a length delivery and it takes the edge through to stand-in keeper Tom Latham
lands a yorker on middle, digs it out
length ball on off stump, handled
sends down a bouncer, at 138 kph, on and around off stump. Faulkner tucks his head into his armpit to avoid it
full on leg stump, deflected past leg gully to get off the mark
shimmies down the track and pushes it down the ground, Santner dives to his left and stops the runs
good work from the man at midwicket, diving to his right to stop a well-timed short-armed jab from leading to runs
fires it in on middle, Faulkner trying to flick it with a closed face, gets a leading edge
fires it in on middle, defends
a little slower through the air, a little shorter in length, Faulkner is unsure what to do with it as he belatedly tries to dab into the leg side
143kph, moves in line with a length ball outside off and guides it to backward point
146kph, goes short and at the body, Stoinis does well to move across and flick it off his hips to long leg
gets up on his toes to a short delivery at 144 kph and blunts it towards point
fuller ball outside off, steps forward to defend
works his wrists over a shortish delivery on off stump and sends it to midwicket
lovely batting. Stoinis looks absolutely unhurried today. Rising up with the short ball outside off and guiding it to point. He's been Australia's player of the day, can he pull off this miracle?
keeps back and flicks a length delivery angled into leg stump to long leg
good length ball - at slower pace - on middle stump. Stoinis is forward with a block
strides down the pitch at the first sign of flight and hammers a ball from outside off down to long-on
waits on a flatter delivery on leg stump and clips it to midwicket
goes back to block on off stump
comes down the track for a length ball on off stump - Santner flattened his length seeing the batsman's tactics - pushes it to midwicket
139kph, full on off stump, blocks it
on the pads, hits the pads and gives Tom Latham a bit of work to do. He runs to his left and parries the ball to leg gully
stands up tall against a back of a length delivery outside off and drills it to cover
goes for a bouncer, and it gains considerable height. Umpire calls it one for the over as it flies past Stoinis' left shoulder
goes for the drive the moment he sees a ball full and outside off, gets a thick edge which flies down to deep third man. Good work from Munro, keeping that to one, sprinting to his right
full and down leg, picks it to long leg. Might be it for Ferguson
starts with a back of a length delivery on middle, Faulker is up off his toes to tuck the ball into midwicket
moves outside off to take a short delivery on leg stump and pull it to long leg

pats a length delivery to mid-off, seems a little odd that he played that off the back foot, possibly why he mistimes it. Perhaps realised his mistake late because at the last minute he was trying to play with a straight bat rather than the horizontal one for a late cut
top edges over the wicketkeeper. Extra bounce from Neesham troubles Stoinis, who commits to a pull despite not having the room to free his arms
shortish and outside off, slices it to point
digs it in short over middle and off stump - gains a little too much height for the umpire's liking as Stoinis leaves
pure power. He picks the slower delivery - so that shows how composed he is at the crease - and then he maximises on the poor ball - short and outside off - by placing it to the right of long-on
back of a length and outside off, pushes it to cover
thumps a backfoot drive past short cover's right and gets a single. A bit of early evidence that Stoinis can bat up the order if needed
deceives him with a slower ball, slanted full and outside off. Faulkner flicks it, looking ungainly, to mdiwicket
stands tall and pulls a short ball from outside off through straight midwicket.
another pull, well controlled as he swivels on his back foot and places it to deep square leg

that's bowling to his field. With plenty of people waiting on the off side, Boult pitches it up and his angle from over the wicket does the rest. Faulkner, caught in the crease, pushes with his hands and is beaten
full and outside off, he drills it to mid-off
good length ball on middle, defends
looks for the blockhole on off stump, Stoinis, while trying to flick it away, ends up only pushing it back down the pitch
onto the pads, worked away to long leg
shortish and outside off, cut behind point
waits a touch too long that time, trying to pick the gap behind point and ends up being beaten. Threw his head back at the lack of execution
back of a length on off stump, blocks it
full and outside off, lashes it to cover
goes for a bouncer at 139 kph, Faulkner gets below it comfortably
looks for the yorker on off stump, flicks it to mid-on
lets the short ball come to him and then dabs it on top of the bounce to deep third man
fuller delivery angled across the right-hander, who leaves it well alone
on the pads, clips it to long leg
good length on off stump, blocks it down the pitch
134 kph, back of a length and outside off, Stoinis punches it into the covers
flicks through midwicket
finally Australia have their hundred, as Neesham spills a length ball down leg
comes down the track, that big backlift going high, but Neesham follows Faulkner, cramping him for room and getting the ball to come up towards his stomach. Can only slice to point
jumps back in his crease to nudge a shortish delivery behind square leg, and since he plays with soft hands, and placed it well to the right of Southee, there's always two on offer
back of a length and outside off, Stoinis gets in line with a straight bat
just a little shape away on this 124 kph good length delivery outside off, and Stoinis who stands and drives on the up is comfortably beaten
goes wide of the crease to try and straighten the ball, but there's not as much on offer this time. Stoinis is back and across with a handsome push to cover
takes a short ball from outside off and pulls through midwicket
shortish and outside off, carves it past point to deep third man
fuller delivery on off stump, defends
short of a length and cramps the batsman for room. Punched to mid-on
slightly short and outside off, Stoinis sits deep in the crease and clouts it over midwicket
full and wide outside off, just inside the tramline, as the batsman swishes and does not connect
length ball on off, firmly struck down the ground
backs away, the bowler follows him, mis-hits a drive to mid-off
Stoinis shuffles down the track and makes room. Ferguson digs it in short, but he still slots a cut wide enough of point and fetches a boundary
length and outside off, punched to cover on the front foot
very full, overpitched outside off, Stoinis drills it through mid-off. Stoinis is giving a good account of himself in his second ODI
short of a length on middle, goes back and fends it to cover
tossed up on off stump, slugged flat and hard over long-on, evades a diving Munro and hits the hoarding on the full
dug short and outside off, Stoinis sizes it up and nails a pull over midwicket. Follows his three-for with a fifty
back of a length, flicked towards the midwicket region
darted flat on the pads, hangs back and turns the ball to the right of midwicket
slightly short and wide outside off, chopped away to cover
floated full on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
112.1ks, rolled down the leg side, past the glance, difficult take for Latham to his left
crunched to deep backward point for one
full and straight, clipped away square on the leg side
another leg-side wide
full and straight, whipped away to long-on
little roller on the pads, tickled away square of short fine leg

'caaaatch,' is the cry but Stoinis, though he has skewed this off the outside half of the bat, has placed it to the right of the sweeper cover. Comes down the track and goes at a flighted delivery as hard as he could
spears it into the blockhole on off stump, he drills it back to long-off
spears it into the blockhole on off stump, he drills it back to long-off
shortish and outside off, but with the pace being a lot slower, Faulkner's attempt to force the pace with a cut doesn't work. Finds cover
looks for the arm ball, but it strays well wide of off stump
pushes it through cover
looks to take a length ball from well wide of off stump and sweep it away. Ends up mistiming to square leg, looks to snitch a single but is rightly sent back
shortish and outside off, Faulkner whips it to long-on from deep in his crease
falls short of Ferguson at short third man. Stoinis was trying to slice a boundary to third man, but the change in pace does him

topples him and Eden roars with Munro! It's the cross-seamer coming down on a good length, stump-to-stump. Faulkner swings across the line and he groans the moment he misses the ball. He knows where it is heading. Doesn't look back
beats him first ball as a good length ball outside off invites the drive. Cummins goes for it, looking for cover but comes up with nothing. Good take from Latham standing up behind the stumps
now Latham's gone back and watches a good length ball outside off being driven to cover
back of a length and outside off, taps it through extra cover
133kph, defends a back of a length delivery outside off off the bottom of the bat
mistimes a pull, looks a bit like he was into the shot a tad too early and was trying to adjust. Lucky the ball lands well in front of deep midiwcket
full on off stump, defends
good length ball, skirting by beside off stump, with the slip and wicketkeeper watching its progress. Cummins shoulders arms
full and outside off, Cummins opens the face but finds point

past first slip, Taylor diving to his right, stretching out a hand cannot get there. Can't really be called a drop. Good bowling from Ferguson though, hitting a good length and inviting the unchecked drive.
back of a length and outside off, Stoinis punches a single to cover
dragged down outside off, Cummins punishes Munro, pulling hard over midwicket
much better from Munro. Full and just a shade outside off, pushed down to long-on
back of a length on middle, manufactures room by backing away and stabs it with a flat bat down to long-off
full, barely 103ks, on off, chipped in the air and just clears Williamson at mid-off. Delectable shot
slightly short and outside off, chopped to short third man
mighty full on off, swiped across the line to wide mid-on
back of a length and thuds into the splice of the bat. Fended back to the bowler
full and outside off, drives through the line to extra cover
short of a length and outside off, smartly late cut away to the right of deep third man

and it fetches him s a boundary right away with some help from Southee who fumbles sliding at mid-on and going for the ball with only one hand. Slower short ball outside off, swatted to the long-on fence
back of a length and outside off, punched to mid-off
chopped from off stump to point
back of a length on middle, chipped to the right of Guptill at short midwicket

length ball outside off, pinged over the covers. Williamson slides at the edge of the boundary and knocks it back in. Or is he in contact with the ball while brushing the hoarding? Yes, it seems like, it's a four
back of a length and outside off, flat-batted to mid-off who is inside the circle
short ball, slung in on off, rushes the batsman into a pull. Top-edged in the air between keeper and slip
length ball outside off, flat-batted away to the left of mid-on. Southee dives to his left and takes some pace off the  ball
back of a length on off, ripe for a launch right now. Back of the hand slower ball, dispatched disdainfully over midwicket
rapid short ball, skids into strike the thigh. Beaten for pace
Guptill flies to his right from extra cover, stretches his right hand out, nearly pulls off a one-hander. The ball hits the wrist and goes down. Saves a boundary. Cummins sliced a drive in the air
shortish and outside off, flayed to point, tumbling save
turn and bounce, beats the slash
tossed up, down the track and drilled back
reverse-paddled from the stumps to short third man
looped up on off stump, slogged across the line to deep midwicket
skips out, converts it into a full-toss and belts it to long-off

Santner beats Cummins in the air, beats him with turn and snaffles him. He does not have many variations, isn't fancy, but is pretty smart. Cummins jumps down the track. The bowler lobs it up wide outside off and finds some turn as well. Latham helps himself to another stumping.
leg-side wide
length ball outside off, Stoinis backs away outside leg and clobbers it over cover. Picked the offcutter and hit the pants off it
slower bouncer, too high. Wide called
too full on off, Stoinis gets under it and hoists it over long-on. Clean strike
lifter on middle, the batsman sways his upper body out of the way
back of a length on off, Stoinis moves into the 90s with a lusty club over the bowler's head. Williamson's anxiety grows
low full-toss on off, slapped flat and hard to long-off. Williamson drops it. Stinging blow. He dives to his right but the ball pops out
low full-toss, hacked to long-on. 21 off that over
short and wide outside off, waits on it and cracks a cut through backward point
yorker on middle, outside-edged down to third man
flat and sliding across off, square-cut away
full and angled in on off, defended
tossed up outside off, angling away from around the wicket. Starc goes low, attempts a slog-sweep and holes out to deep midwicket. Strikes with the last ball of his spell and eases NZ's nerves
full and straying into the pads, clipped away to square leg
shimmies down the track, meets a short ball, and swats to long-on. Declines the single
bouncer, sails over the batsman, sails over the keeper. Five wides

Boult serves up a length ball on middle, Stoinis dispatches it over long-on and brings up his maiden century in his second ODI. He is the first Australian to take three wickets and hit a hundred in an ODI
backs away outside leg and carves a full-toss up and over wide mid-off. Goes all the way
full and wide outside off, scythes and misses
back of a length on off, camps back, jabs to cover for one
short on leg, following the batsman, chopped to short third man
slower offcutter, clears the biggest boundary at Eden Park with a muscular tug. Slammed over midwicket
dug short and outside off, Stoinis sits back waiting for it and carves over short third man. This is some innings from Stoinis
full on off stump, Southee misses his length again. Stoinis smites it over the short, straight boundary. He is doing it for Australia on his own. Tense faces in the crowd
low full-toss outside off, flat-batted away to long-off. Stoinis declines the single

pandemonium at Eden Park. Full and outside off, front-foot drive to cover from Stoinis. Kane Williamson swoops down on the ball, runs in, then decides to throw the ball to the bowler's end. Santner running in does not gather it cleanly. He can't capitalise on the mix-up between the wickets. Stoinis could have been dismissed, instead he runs across for one and pinches the strike
low full-toss on off, dragged away towards wide long-on. Broom makes a sprawling save, sliding to his right from deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, sliced away over cover. The ball swirls to the right of third man. He does not take the single. Two on offer. He does not take it either
full and outside off, driven to cover
140.2ks short ball, fizzes off the surface, cramps the batsman for room and pings the glove, beating the hook
back of a length and on off stump, 138ks, slogged away to the right of Broom at deep midwicket

Has Stoinis nicked it behind? Not given by Palliyaguruge. And they cross over. Latham should have run up and attempted to flick the ball onto the stumps. New Zealand challenge the on-field not out decision. Good-length indipper,cramps the batsman for room. He jams his bat down, the ball grazes the flap of the front pad and carries through to the keeper. Snicko picks up a spike - that's when the ball hit the pad. No clear evidence of an inside snick. Umpire Dharmasena checks from various angles. Excellent awareness from Stoinis and Hazlewood. Not so much from Latham
low full-toss, hit to deep midwicket, but they don't run
Ripping effort from Broom. He dives full length to his left and meets the ball on a half-volley and knocks it away towards long-off. Wide yorker, dragged away to wide long-on
full and outside off, slapped away to cover
similar ball - full and wide outside off - Stoinis throws his hands at it and slices it over cover. Clears the bigger boundary
low full-toss outside off, smeared over long-off for a six. Fifty partnership with no contribution at all from Hazlewood. He hasn't faced a ball yet. Unbelievable scenes at Eden Park

Venue: Eden Park. Hero: Kane Williamson. Result: New Zealand win a thriller! You've heard that before? Whoa.... What a game. Breathless stuff. First let us give credit to Williamson for placing himself at short mid-on. Southee nails a yorker on off stump, Stoinis can only dig the ball out fairly straight to Williamson. He collects the ball, falls in front of the stumps, and under-arms it into the stumps to catch Hazlewood short. Hazlewood had lost his head. He was off for a single - there wasn't a single there - he has to spin back. He dishes out a desperate dive, but that's not enough. This is the first time Hazlewood has been dismissed in an ODI. Spare a thought for Marcus Stonis, though. Nearly pulled off an incredible heist from nowhere
